questions: What is commercial unit of energy ?
What is electric power ? State its SI unit.
answers: Rate at which energy is consumed is called electric power. Its unit is watt.

questions: Name the instrument used for measuring :  Potential difference  Current.
On what principle is an electric bulb based ?
Mention one reason why tungsten is exclusively used for making filaments of electric lamps.
answers: Tungsten has a high resistivity and a high melting point. So, most of the power consumed by this, is dissipated in the form of heat.

questions: How is an ammeter connected in a circuit to measure the current flowing through it ?
What determines the rate at which energy is delivered by a current ?
answers: Electric power determines the rate at which energy is delivered by a current.

questions: In a circuit if two resistors of 5 W and 10 W are connected in series. Compare the current passing through the two resistors.
answers: In a series connection of resistors, same current passes through all the resistors. Hence, current will be same. Ratio of the current will be 1 : 1.

questions: Why are coils of electric toasters and electric irons made of alloy rather than pure metals ?
answers: Alloys are preferred to make coils of toasters and irons because they have higher resistivity and do not oxidise easily at high temperature.

questions: Find the minimum resistance that can be made using five resistors, each of 5Ω.
answers: By connecting resistors in parallel, resistance 1Ω is obtained R 5Ω Req = = 1Ω n

questions: Which is having more resistance—a 220 V, 100 W bulb or a 220 V, 60 W bulb.
